name: Probably the worst build you've seen - Greedy Dwarf: Rogue 13 / Monk 1 / DD 26
author: EasternPromises

posts.author: EasternPromises
posts.content:
Good evening people that look over build ideas:

I'm looking for a sanity check. Is this guy even worth building? I wanted a DR tank with decent AC and AB with epic Dodge. This here is the worst build I've come up with so far:

*7 (8 w/ divine power scroll) attacks, Epic Dodge, almost max DR, competitive AC/AB, and all the rogue goodies like UMD, traps, and open lock because why not. I figured with UMD and a scroll/wand/crafting character to supplement you could pull together respectable numbers, such as with divine power. It is technically playable throughout and can even solo alright but let's face it, this is a level 40 build that was way to greedy.

Important note: This character was made for Blackstone Keep (fairly high magic), so no multi-class pen that I can tell, otherwise you have a multi-class penalty starting from 17.

posts.author: Thorsson
posts.content: How does it do damage?

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
EasternPromises wrote: Good evening people that look over build ideas:

I'm looking for a sanity check.
So what do you guys think? Too greedy?
I think this is an inventive build, for better or worse.
It is a common mistake for new players to make too ambitious builds. They want too much in, and end up making something weak, because the build lacks focus.
People that want to learn improve. Nothing insane with that.

Defensively, you get a lot of things right with fair saves, a high Con, ED and a lot of DR. You even overdo it a bit when you have UD from Rogue in a DD build.
AB is OK'ish for a rogue, nothing stellar, but something a rogue can live with. But it doesn't live up to fighter types standards. You take a level of monk to be able to use the UBAB schedule with Kama in robes. An AC of 29 is only so,so. But the ED and DR repairs that to some degree ( I have not calculated how well atm.)

This is a dex build and needs a way to deal serious damage with the Kamas. Here Thorsson's post is to the point. You have SAs and UMD to buff your weapons from scrolls. You don't have stealth skills, so you depend completely on either IKD or quaffing potions of invisibility to land SAs. With that AB of 38, it can be a bit of a challenge to land IKDs consistently in a toe to toe combat.
You have an interesting skill selection, with UMD, a maxed listen skill and trap skills for epic traps.
UMD may save your day (or not) with weapon buffs from scrolls. The epic trap skills make this build a dangerous trapper, something very unusual for a DD. The lack of stealth skills may make it difficult to scout enemies you want to trap. But also here invisibility potions may be a solution.

Final judgement: This inventive build has several strengths and weaknesses. How well it fares depends heavily on where you play: What you are up against and what items that are available. There is also that challenge that a build like this depends equally well on the skill of the player; to use it's strengths and find ways to minimize the weaknesses.

Mick
Authorized sanity evaluator

posts.author: EasternPromises
posts.content:
Thanks for the input guys! Looking it over I realize this build makes a lot more sense when you have context.

Blackstone keep is fairly high magic and easy to get a group together. I admit I'm leaning heavily into my current socketed Kama that has 3 extra sources of damage and scrolls from a cleric crafter. Invis and darkfire are easy to come by. I don't think this build has a hope in any other magic setting.

I want to be able to heavily punish enemies that look away from me with sneak attack and tank effectively when they get mad. With access to enough items to heavily buff Str, Dex, and Wis I figure the AC and damage can be respectable.

I guess the question is can he be a good addition to a team of 3? This guy, an AA, and a spellcaster? Or should I just be a good nwn player and build a defensive Andariel?

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: This build may be ruling the neighborhood, but will struggle to be a realm champion.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
In a high magic environment where you can max out and get immunities to "everything" and still need to play the game of 20s to hit, my best tip is to build a creature with high AC, ED and SCV with many attacks per round. You put all available upgrades on the weapons. It will wither down any* strength build, no matter how powerful, unless they regenerate more than you are able to damage, in which case you have a stalemate.

*There are monster bosses on multiplayer PWs that are made to even outlast this, to encourage team play.

posts.author: EasternPromises
posts.content:
Ah well. No DR tank for me. Back to building on the monk AC / ED potential.

(SCV = Self concealment 5 instead of relying on a buff?)

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: Buffs (Improved invisibility and Displacement) may be "undispellable" by Greater dispel, but not safe from Mords. But even Mords is linked to caster levels. SCV is the only 100% safe 50% concealment together with the (time limited) Empty body feat from monk. Improved Invisibility from Assassins use the character level (not assassin level) to determine caster level for dispelling purposes and is thus harder to dispel than usual.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Hm, this turns out to be a serious build, after all, I waited to see someone finally tackle Mick's Epic Scholar but this isn't the one...

Contrary to what you might think though, this build has more potential for a mid-magic world/module than what you give it credit for.
Let's say we calculate his AC for Blackstone Keep (29+40+12+4+4=89 AC) & then for a medium +5 items world (29+20+12+4+4=69 AC).
While 89 AC is nothing to brag about in B.K. that 69 AC in any medium-magic world is really good especially when we consider the E.D. on top of it.
And he has 27 DR as well?
Damn...I just need to find a good kama & a wand of Darkfire/GMW and that's it, it may not be a damage king but he will do his job (more than) well enough.

I like it.

posts.author: EasternPromises
posts.content:
Thanks Valerfor. I like the medium magic idea. On every PW I play on I level a crafting character along side for exactly that reason, who doesn't just LOVE UMD??? Let some sucker spellcaster do all the work for you. Kill things, get gold, buy more magic. And bags. So many bags.

He *does* have up to 8 attacks and 7d6 sneak attack, so at the very least he can hope to force creatures to deal with him and stay off his more damage oriented allies, making his tankyness shine and the meager damage less relevant.

posts.author: neo.dietrich
posts.content: I certainly wouldn't want to face this guy. It's hard to think of how I'd kill him. That said... I also wouldn't feel terribly threatened. I'm thinking of that ST:TNG episode where Data faces that game master. You're not going to beat him, but you might be able to play him to a standstill. And with this build, that's a big "might".
